deck: The fifth major story arc for the new Green Hornet, Brit Reid Jr and his partner Mulan Kato.  The newest mayor of Century City has a plan to take down the Green Hornet once and for all.
description:
Moon Beam and Scowl come back to Century City but Scowl is murdered and Moonbeam joins Green Hornet to avenge his mentor. Meanwhile unknown to the Hornet, an ambitious Kent Palmer is fired from the Mayor's Office, but instead of going quietly he hatches a plan to get rid of the Mayor.

Green Hornet break-up an armed robbery, but Britt is hurt badly and needs some time to recoup. Meanwhile Kato, leaves Century city to handle a personal matter, and Kent Palmer, starts his plan by freeing a mass murder known as Mister Jenson, from death row.

Palmer then has Jenson dress as the Green Hornet and kill the Mayor in front of news cameras and witnesses. When Britt and Mulan hear about this they spring into action. While on patrol Mulan is stopped by the C.C. Police, and is saved by Lt. Chritton. Meanwhile Britt fights Jenson, on a rooftop.

Jenson is able to beat up Britt, and the real Green Hornet barely makes it away. He meets up with Mulan who is with Chritton, but Chritton is gunned down by a crooked cop, and Mulan and Britt make a break for it.

They sneek into an abandon mall, where they are tracked down by Jenson, once again. It looks like has them both dead to rights, when Moonbeam shows up and saves them. Jenson almost gets away but Britt chases him to the roof and beats him with a lead pipe. The police show up and take Jenson's body away.

Days later, Britt uses the Sentry Newspaper to take Palmer down and vows to clean up Century City.
name: Outcast

deck: A story arc from The Dreaming.
description:
When the original Corinthian was still on the loose during Morpheus's absence, he went on a legendary killing spree. His calling card: Eating the eyes of young men before torturing them to death. One time, however, was running wild in a small town in Georgia, he left one of his victims alive after taking his eyes. Gabriel Ashe, the victim in question, spent the rest of his life obsessing over the incident. So much so that he partnered up with his boyfriend Echo, and began a string of copy-cat killings.

This ritualistic obsession and recreation of the acts of the original Corinthian caused a breach to develop in the dreaming. An opening between the waking world and the world of dreams. Gabriel had become so close to the Corinthian, that he was drawing the essence of the Corinthian to him, somewhat merging with him in the process.

In order to prevent the breach from growing any further, The Corinthian and Matthew go out into the waking world to track down the killers. Due to the connection between them, Gabriel is able to sense that he is being hunted. When he inserts the eyes of his victims into his empty sockets, he is able to see what The Corinthian can see. Interrupted in the middle of ritualistically killing a young woman, they are only able to take one eye before fleeing.

Echo prepares a magic spell to use against their pursuers, but when they are cornered in a bar Gabriel has a different plan. Gabriel betrays Echo by stealing one of his eyes and fleeing, leaving Echo to bleed to death in a bathroom stall. Corinthian and Matthew find him, but ultimately he is spared due to Matthew's good nature.

The Corinthian returns to the Dreaming and allows Gabriel to pull him into the breach. Its here that The Corinthian performs his actual function as mankind's dark mirror by psychologically torturing Gabriel into see how he really is. The story is vague as to what Gabriel's fate is, though future comments by Echo imply that he is still alive in a mental institution. In any case, The Corinthian's actions close the breach and he returns to his citadel where he thanks Matthew for his help.

Though Echo was ultimately just an incidental character in this story (just a means to aid the blind Gabriel in committing his murders), he would go on to be a key figure in multiple stories and is the first new recurring character introduced since the launch of The Dreaming.
name: Souvenirs

first_appeared_in_issue.name: Tears for a Dark Rose - Book 1: The Unwalked Path

issues.name: Tears for a Dark Rose - Book 1: The Unwalked Path
The Dark Rose - Part Two: A Shadowed Heart

description:
In the Dreaming, in Eve's cave, Matthew is having a nightmare when he is dragged by a slimy creature into the back of the cave where he disappears. Picking up from events of the Souvenirs story arc, Echo has been depressed and living in a big house as a servant for a creature claiming to be Anton Arcane. Arcane forces Echo to perform a ritual supposedly intended to summon The Corinthian to the waking world. However, when the smoke clears, the only thing that has been summoned into the room with Echo is a raven-black stone.

In actuality, the ritual was meant to summon Matthew back to life in a human body in the waking world. Matthew is found, naked and stumbling through the streets, and is brought to a police station where they notify his former wife Abby Holland. When she insists that her husband is dead, and Matthew behaves erratically, he is committed to a mental ward.

Eve, desperate to feel the company of her raven again, insists on traveling to the waking world to retrieve Matthew. Lucien, a former raven himself, refuses to let Eve go alone and returns to the body of a raven to accompany her on her journey.

Abby eventually agrees to meet Matt at the hospital. He tries to get his life back to the way it was before his death, but Abby explains that she's moved on in the many years he's been gone. He still feels a need to save her from the threats she faced before he died, while she insists that he already saved her years ago. It's now that Anton Arcane leaves the house and descends upon Matt's hospital room.

Eve calls in an ancient favor from the bird's of the city, and summons the souls of her former ravens and asks that they aid her in tracking Matthew. The birds bring her to the house where Echo is residing, because they are attracted to the black stone that was summoned in the ritual. Echo mistakes Lucien in his raven form for Matthew, who she holds a grudge against for being an associate of The Corinthian. Refusing to relinquish the stone and intent on killing Lucien, Eve is forced to attack Echo and leaves her for the birds to pick at. Lucien then takes the stone and flies to Matt in the hospital.

Under attack by Anton Arcane, Abby explains that this can't be her Uncle Anton because he had reformed years ago. They realize that in truth, this being was just a manifestation of Matthew's nightmares. His fear of having failed Abby and needing to save her, and his anxiety over never being a man again brought to life through the power of the Dreaming or maybe Eve's cave of nightmares. Matthew's nightmare crossed over into the waking world, where it manifested as a villain that had previously threatened his wife, which then summoned Matthew back to life so he could live out his anxieties. Presumably the nightmare sought out Echo due to his grudge and his recent proximity to a breach in the Dreaming.

Matthew accepts that his life as a man came to a close and accepts the black rock, which was the manifestation of his discarded raven body. Returned to his bird body, he, Lucien, and Eve return to the Dreaming where Matthew can sleep once more, content, in Eve's cave.
name: UN-kindness OF One

deck: Newly commissioned Plexus Ranger Reuben Flagg is assigned to Chicago Plexmall where every Saturday night the local Gogangs get liquored up, doped to the gills, and attack. With his new friends and a few potential enemies, Reuben sets about fighting the status quo.
description:
Story Synopsis

The first three issue story arc for Howard Chaykin's seminal series American Flagg. All the major players are introduced, and the state of the dystopian world is laid out. Reuben Flagg sets out to right wrongs and bring justice to the remains of America. Hard Times is the initial story arc to the American Flagg series. It introduces Reuben Flagg and most of the major supporting characters, as well as a lot of minor background players who become important in later issues. The story follows Reuben's first few weeks as an active duty Plexus Ranger assigned to Plexmall 7 in Chicago, Illinois

Collected Editions

  • First Comics Graphic Novel #3: American Flagg! Hard Times
  • American Flagg! The Definitive Edition

first_appeared_in_issue.name: Hard Times, Part 1: Back in the USA!!

name: Hard Times

issues.name: Hard Times, Part 1: Back in the USA!!
Hard Times, Part 2: Jukebox Saturday Night!
Hard Times, Conclusion: Killed in the Ratings!

deck: Reuben escorts Mayor Blitz's illegal basketball team on a whirlwind tour of South America and Cuba. Hijinks ensue.
description:
Story Synopsis

Reuben gets drafted by Mayor Charles Keenan Blitz to act as escort for his black market basketball team the Skokie Skullcrushers. While in Brasilia, Reuben meets con man extraordinaire Sam Louis Obispo, who gets involved in a big way when the A.S.L.C. political action committee plans to kill Ranger Flagg. With help from Sam, new gal pal Crystal Gayle Marakova, and the Skullcrusher front line, Reuben takes on the A.S.L.C. and a whole lot of corrupt Plexus Rangers.

Collected Editions

First Comics Graphic Novel #12: American Flagg Southern Comfort

American Flagg! Definitive Edition

name: Southern Comfort

issues.name: Southern Comfort! Part 1: Reuben and the Pirates
Southern Comfort! Part 2: Sudden Death Overtime

deck: The largest blizzard to hit Chicago in recent memory has the town shut down, and Reuben has a murder investigation on his hands that opens up all sorts of new problems.
description:
Story Synopsis

Dormant Russian weather satellite Sprite is reactivated by a wayward meteor strike, plunging the entire upstate area of Illinois into one of the worst Blizzards on record. This gets complicated when the 4 Worlds Airways luxury liner Norman Bel Getteys crashes in the wilderness with Medea Blitz on board. Reuben lands smack in the middle of a Plex plot to sell off most of Midwestern United States when a murder investigation goes sideways.

Collected Editions

First Comics Graphic Novel #20: American Flagg!: State of the Union

American Flagg!: The Definitive Edition

name: State Of The Union

issues.name: State of the Union, Part 1: The Blizzard of '32
State of the Union! Part 2: Take This Job and Shove It!!

deck: John Scheiskopf stages a coup at the Chicago Plexmall. Together with his political action committee the A.S.L.C. they hatch a diabolical plan to empty out the city of Chicago.
description:
Story Synopsis

While Reuben is away in downtown Chicago investigating a murder, his old enemy John Scheiskopf with a little help from Desiree Deutchmarx takes over Plexmall 7. Reuben wraps up his investigation just in time to stage his own revolution. With a little help from his friends, Reuben goes to the mat one final time with Scheiskopf and The A.S.L.C. and this time the revolution will be televised.

Collected Editions

American Flagg! Definitive Edition
name: Solidarity For Now

deck: Reuben gets sent to Western Canada to help establish a Plex presence in the backwoods area of People's Prairie. Things go off the rails when a terrorist calling himself The Black Beaver decides to help out.
description:
Story Synopsis

Sherman Peabody sends Reuben into the lawless wilderness of Western Canada. His mission is to establish a new division of Plexus Rangers based out of the town People's Prarie. As usual, Reuben walks into a snake pit of dirty politics, domestic terrorism and murder. Things go from bad to worse when the local terrorist decides to "help out", and as usual Reuben gets caught in the middle.
name: Northern Lights... Double Cross

deck: The mayoral race heats to a boiling point in true Chicago fashion, with Reuben as usual caught right in the middle.
description:
Story Synopsis

Amanda Krieger and Charles Keenan blitz are the front runners in the race to fill the vacant mayoral seat left by Desiree Deutchmarx when she took over under the Scheiskopf regime. It's politics in true Chicago style complete with bribery, cajoling and dirty money and Reuben is caught right in the middle with his only option to mitigate the damage on both sides, and just to add a little spice to the soup, there's a new crime boss in town and he doesn't like competition.
name: Bullets And Ballots!

deck: Reuben gets sent on special assignment to England where he gets trapped in the inevitable web of politics and murder.
description:
Story Synopsis

Sherman Peabody sends Reuben on special assignment to the newly rebuilt city of London. For years the English and the Irish have been at each others' throats. The only thing they can agree on is a temporary cease-fire while Mark Thrust is on. Peabody spearheads the peace talks with a live show of Mark Thrust but it's merely a cover up for his real plans. Reuben meets an old flame who isn't what she appears to be, and of course everything goes sideways as Peabody's true plans surface.
name: Mad Dogs And Englishmen!

deck: Raul's first few weeks in office as mayor of Chicago prove disastrous when he makes a clandestine deal with Desiree Deutchmarx.
description:
Story Synopsis

Two rival crime families go to war in downtown Chicago, and things snowball when Desiree Deutchmarx gets involved. Raul, acting as the newly elected mayor of Chicago proves a willing dupe when she gets him addicted to a new strain of super catnip. Things go from bad to worse when the Plex militia gets involved and Reuben has to swoop in at the last minute to save the day. This time, however he may be too late.
name: The Fire This Time

issues.name: Escape From Riverdale Chapter Two: Dance of the Dead
Escape From Riverdale Chapter Four: Archibald Rex
Escape from Riverdale Chapter Five: Exodus

deck: Sam Louis Obispo returns to Chicago with Ranger Arcadia Driftwood hot on his heels. His new scam is to take the illegal black market wrestling world by storm with his prize wrestler... The Black Beaver!
description:
Story Synopsis

Ranger Arcadia Driftwood visits her old friend Roger Deutchmarx who asks her to search for his missing daughter. She accepts and immediately discovers Sam Louis Obispo smack in the middle of an illegal black market wrestling scam. Obispo skips town to Chicago where Reuben and the gang get caught up in the mix. Meanwhile, Reuben has problems of his own thwarting Mandy's attempts to gut his yearly budget and C.K.'s attempts to take over the troubled QUSA.
name: That's Entertainment

deck: William Windsor Jones is kidnapped by modern day royalists and spirited away to the new residence of the current King of England... Oklahoma.
description:
Story Synopsis

When England melted down during the Year of the Domino, the surviving British Lords purchased Oklahoma from The Plex where they rule in absentia, exploiting the local Indian tribes as de-facto reality TV actors for their own programming. Everybody knows that William Windsor Jones, the on air newscaster and head of programming for Chicago's pirate video station QUSA claims to be the rightful heir to the throne of England, but when he gets kidnapped by modern day royalists who want the current King out of power, Reuben gets involved.
name: Oklahoma U.K.

deck: The ultimate chapter of the first American Flagg Series. Reuben finally makes it back to Mars and finds out that things aren't exactly the way they seemed.
description:
Story Synopsis

Reuben Flagg rejoins the rangers and comes back to Chicago. Things are worse than ever, however as there is currently no Chief Ranger, and the mayor has been assassinated. Chicago is a disaster area and things go from bad to worse when Yuri is appointed Chief Ranger over Reuben. Flagg gets mixed up with Grace DeWolfe again and tracks her and her new domestic terrorist group to the newly reestablished Mars Shuttle. After a short scuffle the shuttle launches and Reuben is bound for Mars where he'll finally get to confront the masters of The Plex face to face... or will he?
